fullText: Mr. Strong brings a magnetic intensity to Eddie Carbone that makes you understand how this ordinary man becomes the author of his own destruction.
dtliExcerpt: Mr. Strong brings a magnetic intensity to Eddie Carbone that makes you understand how this ordinary man becomes the author of his own destruction.
bwwExcerpt: This must be what Greek tragedy once felt like, when people went to the theater in search of catharsis. Ivo van Hove's magnificent reconception ofArthur Miller's 'A View From the Bridge,' which opened on Thursday night at the Lyceum Theater, takes you into extreme emotional territory that you seldom dare visit in daily life. At the end of its uninterrupted two hours, you are wrung out, scooped out and so exhausted that you're wide awake. You also feel ridiculously blessed to have been a witness to the terrible events you just saw.
